channel.title: Concepts on Cloud Native Buildpacks
channel.description: Recent content in Concepts on Cloud Native Buildpacks

item.title: What is a buildpack?
item.description: A buildpack is software that transforms application source code into runnable artifacts by analyzing the code and determining the best way to build it.

item.title: What is the lifecycle?
item.description: The lifecycle is a binary responsible for orchestrating buildpacks.

item.title: What is a buildpack group?
item.description: A buildpack group is a list of individual buildpacks that are designed to work together to build an application.

item.title: What are targets?
item.description: The concept of targets is used to identify compatibility between buildpacks and base images.

item.title: What caching strategies are available to buildpacks?
item.description: Learn strategies for caching layers at build-time for future re-use.

item.title: What is a buildpack dependency layer?
item.description: Dependency layers are semantically meaningful layers that are contributed by one or more buildpacks during the build phase, one for each dependency.

item.title: What is a buildpack package?
item.description: A buildpack package refers to the process of packaging buildpacks for distribution as OCI images or OCI-compatible tar files.

item.title: What is a component buildpack?
item.description: A component buildpack is a buildpack containing /bin/detect and /bin/build executables and that implements the Buildpack Interface.

item.title: What is a composite buildpack?
item.description:
A composite buildpack, also sometimes called a “meta buildpack”, is a buildpack that does not contain any ./bin/detect or ./bin/build binaries, but instead references other buildpacks in its buildpack.toml via the [[order]] array.

This is useful for composing more complex detection strategies.

item.title: What is an image extension?
item.description: An image extension is software that generates Dockerfiles that can be used to extend base images for buildpacks builds.

item.title: What is the build plan?
item.description: A build plan is a toml file that is the output of the detect phase, in which each component buildpack or image extension may express the dependencies it requires and the dependencies it provides.
